{{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-265-03-B |Item_parent=Urinary lithiasis |Item_parent_short=Urinary lithiasis |Rank=B |Title=Knowing the frequency of different types of stones |Description=Table showing the frequency of different types of stones |Rubric=Epidemiology |Contributors=Romain Boissier |Order=3}}
{| class="wikitable" |+ Table showing the frequency of the various calculations
| |'''Calcium phosphate'''' | colspan="2" |'''Calcium oxalate'''' |Ammonium magnesium phosphate |Cystine |Uric acid |- |'''Prevalence''' |13% |50% |22% |1% |3% |11% |- |'''Crystalline name'''' |Carbapatite Hydroxyapatite Brushite |Whewelitte |Weddellite |Struvite |- |- |- |'''Macroscopic aspect'''' |Chalky |Smooth brownish |yellowish spiculated |Yellow |Irregular yellow |Smooth yellow |- |'''Urinary pH (normal=5.8)''' |alkaline |Variable |Variable |alkaline |Acid |Acid |- | UH Density |1500-2000 |1200-1700 |1000-1500 |500-900 |600-900 |350-700 |}

question.title: What is the most common type of kidney stone?
question.description: Select the correct answer from the options below

option_a.title: Uric acid stones
option_a.description: A type of stone that forms in the urine

option_b.title: Struvite stones
option_b.description: A type of stone that forms in alkaline urine

option_c.title: Calcium oxalate stones
option_c.description: A common type of stone that forms in the kidneys

option_d.title: Urethral stones
option_d.description: A type of stone that forms in the urethra
